0.cdata!:
Paraguay - Primer Prestamo Programatico
            para Politicas de Desarrollo del Sector Publico

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings of the First Public Sector
            Programmatic Development Policy Loan Project for Paraguay
            were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory; the risk to
            development outcome was moderate to significant; the
            Bank's performance was satisfactory; and the
            Borrower's performance was also satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: the importance of strong national
            ownership of the operation is fundamental to the success of
            a Development Policy Loan (DPL) program. Coalitions of
            political support for a DPL program must be carefully
            assessed before undertaking ambitious reforms. Both
            political feasibility and depth of reform must be taken into
            account for the DPL series to be successful. From a
            technical standpoint, reforms that strengthen small
            'concentrated' teams with important leverage
            provide opportunities for large pay-offs. Sustained
            engagement on the part of the Bank is critical to
            effectively support reform processes over the medium and
            long term. Combining technical assistance and DPLs generate
            mutual leverage for achieving development objectives.
